discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C.) TACACS+ (Terminal Access Controller Access Control System Plus) is a security protocol that authenticates users who want to access a network device. It's commonly used to provide administrative access to routers and switches.

questions.question_text: A technician needs to implement a system to handle both authentication and authorization. Which of the following meets this requirement?

A user reports that a workstation is operating sluggishly. Several other users operate on the same workstation and have reported that the workstation is operating normally. The systems administrator has validated that the workstation functions normally. Which of the following steps should the systems administrator most likely attempt NEXT?

comments.content: isn't adding system memory or virtual ram to that specific solve the problem too?

discussion.content:
A, B, D and E would have an effect to all users in this computer.
Only C makes a change only to the one user, who has Problems.

The question went out of its way to specify that ONLY this user is having problems on the PC, while others using the same system have no issues. This means the PC is just fine, its most likely the users profile.

Selected Answer: D
i think adding system memory would be the right answer and if this doesn't solve then the rebuild of users profile. Please help me if this is right. taking the exam in 4 days

Selected Answer: C
Like that other comment said, C would only affect the current user and would most be the most likely out of them to solve the problem.

questions.question_text: A systems administrator needs to access a hypervisor that went offline. After doing a port scan, the administrator notices that company policy is blocking the RDP default port. Which of the following ports should the administrator use to access the machine?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Port 22 (SSH) isn't listed in the scenario, so I would have to assume they would use the alternative port for RDP, which is 3390. Usually, when 3389 is blocked the alternative port (3390) is used in its place.

Selected Answer: D
Port 3090 is commonly used by VMware vSphere for remote access to the hypervisor, especially for the vSphere Client or the VMware Remote Console. This is likely the alternative access port when the default RDP port is blocked according to company policy.

Selected Answer: A
its A bec. the RDP port is closed and cant be used so the alternative is using SSH connection using port 22

Selected Answer: A
they would connect remotely using ssh

A. 22
Port 22 is commonly used for SSH (Secure Shell), a secure protocol for remote access to computer systems. If the hypervisor is configured to allow SSH access, the administrator can use this port to connect to the machine and troubleshoot the issue.

Google Gemini

Selected Answer: B
I will go with B.

Selected Answer: A
bec, locking the case doesnt prevent unauthorized access to the Pc it self its just to protect the hardware from tampering or theft

D. Locking the computer case
Locking the computer case physically prevents unauthorized access to the device and its components. This is the most effective way to protect the computer from physical threats, such as tampering or theft, when it is left unattended in a common area.

Google Gemini

questions.question_text: A technician is configuring security for a computer that is located in a common area. A sign above the computer indicates only authorized users can use the computer. Guests visiting the office must walk past the computer to enter and leave the office. Which of the following will offer the best protection against physical threats?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Wipe the drives.

Wiping the drives involves using specialized software to overwrite the data multiple times, making it extremely difficult to recover. This is the most effective method to ensure that the PII is completely erased and cannot be retrieved.

GG
